channel.title: What drivers do i need to install
channel.description:
I had to format my laptop and reinstall windows xp, as well as install my drivers. My laptop model is a T40. Now this is the website that i need to download my drivers from(only the T40 cololum):[url]https://www-307.ibm.com/pc/support/site.wss/document.do?sitestyle=lenovo&lndocid=MIGR-46258[/url]
Now under the section Networking: Ethernet and Networking:Wireless, theres a whole bunch of different networking cards. How do i know which is equipped in my laptop?? I cant find out since the hardware is not listed in my device manager, since i didnt install the drivers yet. I tried searching for my model online but even they dont state what networking cards i have. Yesterday i tired installing every driver and testing it out but i had no such luck.
I appreicate any help.

item.title: What drivers do i need to install
item.dc:creator: Lord_Grievous
item.description:
Can’t you see in the BIOS?

Read full topic

item.title: What drivers do i need to install
item.dc:creator: russilker
item.description:
What you need to do is find your ethernet card’s hardware ID thru device manager, and pray that a google search of that hwid will get you the drivers you need.

Read full topic

item.title: What drivers do i need to install
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
In these cases I usually take a screenshot of the device manager’s full list of devices.

It’s a very important thing to do. Before formatting, that is.

Read full topic
